an4.63:1.1: “Mendicants, a family where the children honor their parents in their home is said to live with Brahmā.
an4.63:1.2: A family where the children honor their parents in their home is said to live with the first teachers.
an4.63:1.3: A family where the children honor their parents in their home is said to live with the old deities.
an4.63:1.4: A family where the children honor their parents in their home is said to live with those worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods.
an4.63:2.1: ‘Brahmā’ is a term for your parents.
an4.63:2.2: ‘First teachers’ is a term for your parents.
an4.63:2.3: ‘Old deities’ is a term for your parents.
an4.63:2.4: ‘Worthy of an offering dedicated to the gods’ is a term for your parents.
an4.63:2.6: Parents are very helpful to their children, they raise them, nurture them, and show them the world.
an4.63:3.3: They’re worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods <j>from their children,
an4.63:4.2: would revere them and honor them
an4.63:5.3: they’re praised in this life by the astute,
an4.63:5.4: and they depart to rejoice in heaven.”
